entries.meaning: (surgery) The operation of removing one or more of the bones of the tarsus (cluster of bones in the foot).
examples: That no less than eleven different forms of tarsectomy have been described for the cure of club-foot would seem to show that surgeons have not found any one of these operations giving perfectly satisfactory results.

entries.meaning: (surgery) The operation of removing one or more tarsi (plates of connective tissue, one found in each eyelid).
examples: An important advantage of using Whitnall's sling procedure or the superior tarsectomy modification is that the other alternatives are still available if these procedures should give unacceptable results.
